item.title: Upgradeable proxy contract from scratch
item.description: Photo by Rafał Naczyński on Unsplash Immutability gives Ethereum a big benefit: once a smart contract is deployed, there’s no way to change it. This means that smart contract logic won’t change over time and it’ll remain as reliable as it was from the beginning, e.g. you won’t suddenly see a contract doing something no one thought it could do. However, immutability comes with drawbacks that can be significant in some cases.
